Name: R116 - Heavy Duty Dense Graded Asphalt (Intermediate & Wearing Courses)
Prompting Name: R116 - Heavy Duty Dense Graded Asphalt (Intermediate & Wearing Courses)

Name: Submission of nominated asphalt mix designs (Including items specified in R116 Cl. 2.3.3) at least 7 working days prior to proposed placement.
Acceptance Criteria - Conformance with R116 mix design requirements

Trial Section - Prior to commencement of paving works, the construction of a separate trial section using the plant and personnel proposed for the work for each nominated mix shall occur. Verification checklist and all relevant test results from the trial section demonstrating conformity to the specified requirements shall be submitted to the Principal at least 3 working days prior commencement of paving (at locations other than the trial section)
Acceptance Criteria - Principal review of proposal
Submission of asphalt temperature as per the following:
(a) minimum temperature at which asphalt will be delivered to the paver;
(b) minimum temperature at which initial compaction of the asphalt can still commence;
Acceptance Criteria - Asphalt temperatures included in Project Quality Plan
Traffic and Safety Controls - Traffic and safety controls are in place (eg. PPE, daily plant check)
Acceptance Criteria - Check traffic and safety controls have been implemented as per plan prior to asphalt placement.
Surface prepared to be paved in accordance with AS 2150, including removal of raised extruded thermoplastic road markings and raised pavement markers

Provide to the Principal a signed daily record of the average tackcoat application rate applied to each Lot. Report the tackcoat application rate in terms of residual bitumen and state the percentage dilution of the tackcoat used during spraying.
Acceptance Criteria - Submission of tack coat daily record
Measure and record the temperature of the surface to be paved, and wind velocity at the point of asphalt placing.
Acceptance Criteria - Register of surface temperature and wind velocity
— Vertical joint at the centreline for the full depth of the cut
— Cut at centreline for full extent of project (Ch 140245 - Ch 140340)
(i) located at a minimum of 25 m apart;
(ii) offset by a minimum of 1 m from the joint in the underlying layer;
(iii) formed at the commencement of each paving run;
(iv) formed when a delay in paving causes asphalt temperature to fall below the initial compaction temperature nominated in Clause 3.5.

Temporary Ramps - Temporary ramps constructed at joints for safe trafficking of the work either by placement of asphalt, or by cold milling the existing or new asphalt layer to form the ramp, as appropriate for the application. The length and grade of temporary ramps must be equivalent to those specified for treatment at edges and structures described in Specification TfNSW R101
Compliance Testing shall be carried out for each lot. The Testing Frequencies shall not be less than those listed in Annexure R116/L (Minimum Frequency of Testing)
Submission of the following test reports to the Principal:
(a) combined particle size distribution, binder content and air voids in laboratory compacted mix – within one working day of placing the asphalt;
(b) insitu air voids, course thickness and course shape – within three working days of placing the asphalt.

Straightedge Tolerances - The surface shape of the course within and across traffic lanes must not deviate from the bottom of the straightedge (refer Clause 4.5) laid in any direction by more than the tolerances shown in Table R116.12.
For corrective courses and tie-ins to an existing pavement where nonconforming layer thickness will occur, the following shall be submitted to the Principal:
(a) nominated layer thicknesses which does not conform to specified thicknesses;
(b) work methods capable of producing a dense homogeneous layer at these thicknesses;
(c) areas affected, and evidence that these areas are the absolute minimum necessary
Acceptance Criteria - Principal review of proposal

Nonconforming Lot - Where a HOLD POINT is required to be observed, investigate the causes of the nonconformity, and propose corrective action to prevent recurrence of future nonconformity. Submission of test results for insitu air voids and all properties specified in R116 Cl. 2.2.
Acceptance Criteria - The Principal will consider the submitted documents prior to authorising the release of the Hold Point, and will advise whether the nonconforming Lot can be accepted.

Nonconforming Lot - Nonconforming Lots which are not accepted shall be either rectified or replaced. A nonconformity report and details of proposal to rectify or replace the Lot submitted to Principal.
Acceptance Criteria - Principal review of proposal
Project Manager Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
Client Verify that the Above has been Constructed according to Specification
